conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid from A flows downward and hits the green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid from A to the left.
The liquid from A continues downward and enters container E.
Liquid from B flows downward and hits the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the liquid from B to the right.
The liquid from B continues downward and hits the pink baffle.
The pink baffle directs the liquid from B further to the right.
The liquid from B enters container F.
Liquid from C flows downward and hits the purple baffle.
The purple baffle directs the liquid from C straight downward.
The liquid from C enters container G.
Liquid from D flows downward and does not hit any baffles.
The liquid from D continues straight downward and enters container G.
Final answer: Liquid from A flows into container E, liquid from B flows into container F, liquid from C flows into container G, and liquid from D flows into container G.
